question: Which among the following event led the British government of Lord North to undertake a legislation to meet the situation and provide some form of legal government for the Indian possessions of the East India Company, which resulted in Regulating Act of 1773?
option1: The Officers of East India Company were indulged in all sorts of corruption
option2: East India Company was facing fierce resistance from the Native princes of India
option3: The competition with the French East India Company had almost finished the business of British East India Company
option4: East India Company had become almost insolvent
answer: East India Company had become almost insolvent
explanation: In 1773, the company became almost insolvent and forced to apply to the British Government for a loan of One Million Pound Sterling. This led to the British government of Lord North to undertake a legislation to meet the situation and provide some form of legal government for the Indian possessions of the East India Company, which resulted in Regulating Act of 1773
